ah... in this case, you do have to make sure that the internet is plugged in for testing ;)
but in short...
If ubuntu is trying to get an IP address... you'll see it by the orbs turning green in the "system tray"
it detected the cable... but if a minute passes and it seems to succeed, but you can't get internet... there might be a problem with your internet....
if it doesn't work in XP, there is nothing to do. internet is currently not evailable.
ubuntu is most probably working right now, and the internet is... wait... the internet works right now doesn't it? ;|
in command line, enter this: "ping google.com"
press CONTROL+C to stop it...
cya soon
hello, I didn't see you come in :)
you don't have internet :
ummm... in command line... try the following (You said wired connection right? through your regular ethernet port?))
ifconfig eth0 down; ifconfig eth0 up; dhclient3 eth0;
ok, do "sudo -s" before all that
